page.title: 06Leisure & recreation
page.content: The place where you get the most leisure and recreation is at the University of Lancaster. 80% of students and 20% of the public use the indoor recreation centre. There are many clubs at the University and the students run these themselves. The most used facilities are the swimming and the squash courts. Special rates apply for unemployed, disabled, etc. People come here to keep fit, relax and to meet friends. The following facilities are available to the public: swimming pool, fencing, yoga, tennis, rugby, cricket, football, archery, hockey, squash, weight lifting, table tennis, netball, judo, trampolining, badminton, cross country, orienteering, gymnastics, karate, climbing, cycling. After you have enjoyed trying some of the sports there are saunas & solariums.
